BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
gavin.hall@hoist.tech

Skills Testing Content

Hello,

We need to develop some basic exercises to guide/demonstrate newly onboarded Hoist technical staff on how to perform common tasks. Please create a document for each of the following scenarios. Include in the document:


  *   A brief sentence or two explaining what requirement the document details
  *   Step by step instructions for how to perform the task, including tips and tricks for known issues and work arounds.
  *   Include Screenshots for important steps only

Create a document for:

  *   Using PLSQL developer to connect to a database without TNSNAMES.ORA
  *   How to add a TNSNAMES.ORA entry
  *   How to use the SQL window in PLSQL Developer to run queries
  *   How to create a custom field in IFS (Persistent)
  *   How to create a read only custom field in IFS (SQL expression, statement, and reference
  *   How to create a custom field referencing another LU value set (Combo box / list)
  *   How to create a custom LU / Entity
  *   How to create a quick report (SQL)
  *   How to create a PLSQL Package, with a function that returns a value, and a procedure that loops over a set of records (cursor) and processes them in some way.
  *   How to use IFS DB APIs (Explain Attr strings, OBJID, OBJVER. Also explain OBJKEY (for _CFV views) and how they join to CFT tables.
  *

This will form a useful core of KB documents we can share with new folk coming onboard. Some of this may already exist in some form, may already exist in IFS Online Documentation. If so then let’s leverage it by attaching it to this incident for review. We can always work on standardizing later.

-Gavin Hall

Failure: Remedy Force attachment integration failed. This DOES NOT impact basic ServiceNow functionality. To alert admins, please raise an incident.

Error Message:
bumped up the case with IFS
bumped up the case with IFS

Hi Paul, This part of the ticket need 1st to be checked by Hoist, the incorrect posting is required IFS support, but why value is not picked up in the order is required Hosit/Sadeepa validation 1st before we escalated to IFS
@Bahaa Alkilani I have check the accounting flow and it is bug in the IFS core. Therefore, I have asked Paul to create a ticket with IFS.

Hi, I just need to confirm we are on the same page, as explained by Sadeepa, we have a bug which effecting the system to pick up the correct account and ticket already raised to IFS Core, are you saying that we have another bug which effect value as well?

hi @Bahaa Alkilani,
As per the investigations, sales part prices are not taken when you create a RMA without connecting a customer order. We believe this is a IFS core bug. However,  we need few more information on this case. Could you please let me know is there any other zero value RMA's which is not connected to customer order.

best regards,
Kanishka Undugodapathirana.

Hi @Bahaa Alkilani,

This is a kind follow up on the below mentioned;

"hi @Bahaa Alkilani,
As per the investigations, sales part prices are not taken when you create a RMA without connecting a customer order. We believe this is a IFS core bug. However, we need few more information on this case. Could you please let me know is there any other zero value RMA's which is not connected to customer order.

best regards,
Kanishka Undugodapathirana."

Please note that this is the 1st follow up of 3.

Thanks and Regards,
Nipuni Perera

Hi, I have no idea if there are more RMAs generated with zero value, this RMA was tested by Sadeepa and he suggest to raise a ticket for this. What report we should run for RMA to check if we have zero posting?

hi @Bahaa Alkilani,
After the further investigations, we have concluded that system is not able to pick prices of sales part  when you creating RMA manually even customer order is connected or not. 

to avoid getting zeros in RMA, You have to initiate creating RMA process from customer order when customer order exists in the system. You must use manual RMA creation and must enter the prices manually for any business scenarios which customer order is not exist in IFS system. 

However, this is a bug of core IFS system. Therefore, please raise a ticket for IFS on this matter.

Best regards,
Kanishka Undugodapathirana.

Hi, Please note that we have already raised a ticket for IFS on this matter. To close this ticket, kindly send us a details document for the process flow of RMA creation as well as test examples on what you had mentioned in your below comment. We are having a big volume of RMA transactions and looking forward to document the process, and standardize it within all team raising RMAs. Therefore, pls explain your conclusion on details on word document and share it back to close this ticket as well as the recommended process for RMA creation.

Hi ,

BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
gurpreet.sohal@seaspan.com

Seaspan: Email Auto Notification in IFS -MRB cases 

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
Hi ,

We would like to leverage the Email Auto Notification in the Inspection Tab when creating an MRB case to send email notifications to the various stakeholders who we would like to assign action items to , for example if an inspection needs to be completed for a case I would like to send an email notification to the responsible QC inspector informing him that a report is required for the case the same would apply for a request to a procurement specialist requesting a quote .

I wanted to know if there is a way to create a custom event that will allow an email trigger ?

The trigger will be as soon as a User Assigns a Person and an email will be sent as soon as they hit save to the “Responsible Person” which is a Person ID as shown in screenshot.


  1.  Email should be sent when saving the record with a person ID assigned only.
  2.  Could there be a case where in there is no Person ID assigned? No every  inspection step will have a responsible person who will need to be contacted via email.
  3.  Could there be a case where in you would assign then reassign it to some other person and then want to retrigger the email? Yes that scenario exists and we would like to have the option to assign and reassign the email.

Here is where that would be needed:

[cid:image001.png@01D97D92.E66C8870]

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010615 -  Seaspan: Email Auto Notification in IFS -MRB cases  (Ref:IN:00010615)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Tue, May 16, 2023 18:28 PM
To: gurpreet.sohal@seaspan.com;
Subject: Incident #00010615 -  Seaspan: Email Auto Notification in IFS -MRB cases  (Ref:IN:00010615)

Hi Gurpreet,

I checked with the technical team and this is feasible. We can send an email when the Responsible user field is updated to the email address in the person record. If you update it with a new user an email can be sent to the new user again. Do you have a spec created for this? or do you want me to create one with the solution and send for you to approve?
I can send you an estimation after the specification doc is completed.

Best Regards,
Poornima Maduwanthi

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
Hi Team,

Looking for some assistance with this one.



From: Gurpreet Sohal
Sent: Tuesday, May 16, 2023 7:56 PM
To: Gabby Sabaten <Gabby.Sabaten@seaspan.com>; Marcus Da Freiria Borges <Marcus.Borges@seaspan.com>
Cc: Devesh Sharma <Devesh.Sharma@Seaspan.com>
Subject: IFS: Parts created as Manufactured, Changed to Purchased Parts in IFS not Showing in E1 in PROD

Hi Gabby,

It seems these parts were created as “Manufactured” rather than “Purchased (raw)” or “Purchased ” originally.

I tested, if a part is created as  “Manufactured”  after changing from “Manufactured” to “purchased” or “purchased raw” the integration should generate a call to update E1 Item MAster.
Seems for some reason in PROD it is not doing this due to a bug.

Can this bug be recreated in a Non PROD IFS environment like TEST or DEV?

If not, In order to investigate , I would like to leave 1 or 2 parts from your list  as is in PROD for testing/Investigation purposes .

In the meantime, workaround I have is we can delete the parts from the list below in IFS  and recreate them as “purchased” or “purchased raw” rather than “manufactured” and integration should work.

Here is my test case I tried today, tested 3 scenarios:


  1.  Create “Manufactured”:

[cid:image001.png@01D9882D.991052F0]

  1.  Create “Purchased (Raw)”

[cid:image002.png@01D9882D.991052F0]



  1.  Create “Purchased”

[cid:image003.png@01D9882D.991052F0]




I Checked and can see “Purchased (Raw)”, “Purchased” got updated in E1:

[cid:image004.png@01D9882D.991052F0]
[cid:image005.png@01D9882D.F2A7A840]
Not the “Manufactured”
[cid:image006.png@01D9882D.F2A7A840]


I then later decided to change the “Manufactured” part to “Purchased” , Integration generated the XML and same got updated in E1:

[cid:image007.png@01D9882E.5225C360]

[cid:image008.png@01D9882E.5225C360]

Hi Team,

Looking for some assistance with this one.



From: Gurpreet Sohal
Sent: Tuesday, May 16, 2023 7:56 PM
To: Gabby Sabaten <Gabby.Sabaten@seaspan.com>; Marcus Da Freiria Borges <Marcus.Borges@seaspan.com>
Cc: Devesh Sharma <Devesh.Sharma@Seaspan.com>
Subject: IFS: Parts created as Manufactured, Changed to Purchased Parts in IFS not Showing in E1 in PROD

Hi Gabby,

It seems these parts were created as “Manufactured” rather than “Purchased (raw)” or “Purchased ” originally.

I tested, if a part is created as  “Manufactured”  after changing from “Manufactured” to “purchased” or “purchased raw” the integration should generate a call to update E1 Item MAster.
Seems for some reason in PROD it is not doing this due to a bug.

Can this bug be recreated in a Non PROD IFS environment like TEST or DEV?

If not, In order to investigate , I would like to leave 1 or 2 parts from your list  as is in PROD for testing/Investigation purposes .

In the meantime, workaround I have is we can delete the parts from the list below in IFS  and recreate them as “purchased” or “purchased raw” rather than “manufactured” and integration should work.

Here is my test case I tried today, tested 3 scenarios:


  1.  Create “Manufactured”:

[cid:image001.png@01D9882D.991052F0]

  1.  Create “Purchased (Raw)”

[cid:image002.png@01D9882D.991052F0]



  1.  Create “Purchased”

[cid:image003.png@01D9882D.991052F0]




I Checked and can see “Purchased (Raw)”, “Purchased” got updated in E1:

[cid:image004.png@01D9882D.991052F0]
[cid:image005.png@01D9882D.F2A7A840]
Not the “Manufactured”
[cid:image006.png@01D9882D.F2A7A840]


I then later decided to change the “Manufactured” part to “Purchased” , Integration generated the XML and same got updated in E1:

[cid:image007.png@01D9882E.5225C360]

[cid:image008.png@01D9882E.5225C360]

We are doing the same in PROD but for some reason that is not working.



Regards,
Gurpreet Sohal | Application Analyst II | Seaspan ULC | 210-889 Harbourside Drive, North Vancouver BC V7P 3S1| Office: | www.seaspan.com<http://www.seaspan.com/>

Title__c: Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Hi Hoist team,

We would like to have a custom event that prevents a user to cancel a PO that is connected to another one.
This is because users have cancelled POs connected to a CO, so the process get stuck, and we need to make a data repair to solve
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Hi Hoist team,

We would like to have a custom event that prevents a user to cancel a PO that is connected to another one.
This is because users have cancelled POs connected to a CO, so the process get stuck, and we need to make a data repair to solve this.
Example of this is PO D10455 which is connected to CO P36083 and PO P355636 in IFS 10 Test, I can cancel a line in the PO D10455 and nothing stops me, which is wrong, because the line is still connected, please see screenshot #1, and when I receive the material in PO P355636, the material will be stuck in the CO P36083.

Thanks!

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Received-RE: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com
Sent: Mon, Jul 31, 2023 16:56 PM
To: incident@hoist.tech; 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)


******************************
Attachments sent with this email(1):
	1. image001.png
******************************

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
Hi Ishard,
Hope you are doing well!

We reviewed this event with the team, and we need some changes:

  *   This will only apply to orders that are part of maquila process.
     *   Meaning: orders linked in this way:
        *   External PO – site 1210%
        *   Internal CO – site 1210%
        *   Internal PO – site 1120%
  *   We want the event to replicate the changes applied in the external PO in site 1210% --> to the internal CO and internal PO.
     *   Can be different things that can be replicated:
        *   Cancellation: if the line is cancelled in the external PO this change should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.
        *   Price change: if the price of a line is changed this should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.
        *   Qty change: if the qty of a line is changed this should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.
           *   This must consider the conversion factor.
        *   Planned Delivery Date: when this is change automatically the Planned Receipt Date will be changed as well, so these changes need to be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.
  *   The user must not have access to Cancel the header of the internal PO and internal CO, user should cancel the header of the external PO so the changes will be replicated to the other orders.

Let me know if you want to have a meeting to discuss this. 😉
Thanks!
Kind Regards,
Andrea Hernández
Business Analyst / Continuous Improvement Coordinator

Blvd. Carlos Salinas de Gortari km 7.5
Col. Valle del Mezquital
66632 Apodaca, N.L., México

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Received-RE: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com
Sent: Thu, Aug 10, 2023 10:54 AM
To: incident@hoist.tech; 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)


******************************
Attachments sent with this email(4):
	1. image001.png
	2. image002.png
	3. image003.png
	4. image004.png
******************************

[EXTERNAL EMAIL] DO NOT CLICK links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
Hi Ishard,

Here is the “definition” of how it works and the purpose of this:
Some materials have conversions in the UoM to avoid issues when paying to the supplier because of the variation and the exactitude of the qty, for example.- It used to be difficult for finance to pay for material that arrives in pounds because maybe the PO had 1320 lb as qty but in reality, only arrived 1318.5 lb, so the PO wasn't closed, as it had remaining qty to be received (the same issue for the internal CO and internal PO).
So the fix to that issue was to set conversion factors, so instead of having the PO in pounds, now it is on eaches and the conversion for the inventory is in pounds. In this way, finance will pay for 10 eaches instead of having difficulties with the pounds.
It works like this:

  *   The material is bought in eaches to pay to the external supplier in eaches and avoid issues (external PO 1210%)
  *   The material is receipt in eaches (when registering the arrival, incoming people introduce the receipt qty in eaches) and the system convert the inventory in pounds in site 12103.
  *   The customer is setup as eaches, the sales part converts the pounds of the inventory to eaches for the "shipment" (<<< no shipment in maquila, just moves the material).
  *   The internal PO in 11203 is in eaches so the material is converted from pounds to eaches for the receipt in the PO, and the inventory is showing pounds.
For this to work the inventory part (in acquisition tab) and the supplier for purchase part must have decimals declared in qty calculated rounding.
The inventory conversion factor is set in the sales part and supplier for purchase part.

Example of conversion in maquila process are these orders in Test:
Internal PO - P359089
Internal CO - P36685
External PO - P359090
Part Number - 34100039
Supplier – 108373

Supplier for Purchase Part y Sales Part conversion factor setups:
[cid:image002.png@01D9CB80.97A8E120]

[cid:image003.png@01D9CB80.97A8E120]

[cid:image004.png@01D9CB80.E93B72A0]

Please let me know if you have any doubt 😊
Kind Regards,
Andrea Hernández
Business Analyst / Continuous Improvement Coordinator
T: +1 401 252 5325
ACS Internacional S de RL de CV
Blvd. Carlos Salinas de Gortari km 7.5
Col. Valle del Mezquital
66632 Apodaca, N.L., México
www.acs-cp.com<http://www.acs-cp.com/>
[cid:image001.png@01D9CB80.5BF9A4C0]

From: Andrea Hernandez
Sent: Thursday, August 10, 2023 11:54 AM
To: incident@hgts.tech
Subject: RE: Incident #00010687 - Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected (Ref:IN:00010687)

 

Hi Ishard,

 

Here is the “definition” of how it works and the purpose of this:

Some materials have conversions in the UoM to avoid issues when paying to the supplier because of the variation and the exactitude of the qty, for example.- It used to be difficult for finance to pay for material that arrives in pounds because maybe the PO had 1320 lb as qty but in reality, only arrived 1318.5 lb, so the PO wasn't closed, as it had remaining qty to be received (the same issue for the internal CO and internal PO).

So the fix to that issue was to set conversion factors, so instead of having the PO in pounds, now it is on eaches and the conversion for the inventory is in pounds. In this way, finance will pay for 10 eaches instead of having difficulties with the pounds.

It works like this:

  • The material is bought in eaches to pay to the external supplier in eaches and avoid issues (external PO 1210%)
  • The material is receipt in eaches (when registering the arrival, incoming people introduce the receipt qty in eaches) and the system convert the inventory in pounds in site 12103.
  • The customer is setup as eaches, the sales part converts the pounds of the inventory to eaches for the "shipment" (<<< no shipment in maquila, just moves the material).
  • The internal PO in 11203 is in eaches so the material is converted from pounds to eaches for the receipt in the PO, and the inventory is showing pounds.

For this to work the inventory part (in acquisition tab) and the supplier for purchase part must have decimals declared in qty calculated rounding.

The inventory conversion factor is set in the sales part and supplier for purchase part.

 

Example of conversion in maquila process are these orders in Test:

Internal PO - P359089

Internal CO - P36685

External PO - P359090

Part Number - 34100039

Supplier – 108373

 

Supplier for Purchase Part y Sales Part conversion factor setups:

 

 

 

Please let me know if you have any doubt 😊

Kind Regards,

Andrea Hernández

Business Analyst / Continuous Improvement Coordinator

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Tue, Oct 17, 2023 17:58 PM
To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

Hope you are doing good.

During the testing phase, we encountered several issues as mentioned below related to the requested CRIM.

1. If the line is canceled in the external PO this change should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.

But if we try to Cancel the Ex PO, then the standard error will be triggered as below.


In order to Cancel the Ex PO, as per the error says you have to Cancel, Closed, Unpeg or qty has to be completely manually reserved in the Customer Orders.

But on the other hand, you requested to produce an error when trying to Cancel the internal CO. Therefore we cannot follow the Cancel option as the two behaviors are conflicting. If we unpeg the CO, then the link between orders will be disconnected. 

Hence, could you please check and provide your feedback on how we need to proceed with that requirement?

2. Currently if the user cancels the Int PO/CO, the error will be triggered as requested. But do we need to consider the changes made for Int CO/PO? That means if the user modifies changes in Internal CO or PO, the error should be triggered.

3. And also, since we have to identify the Internal PO/CO and External PO from other orders, we take the assumption as below.

* Internal PO - Order Code =4 & Demand Code = Invent Order
* Internal CO - Supply Code = Purch Order Trans & Demand Code = Int Purch Trans
* External PO - Demand Code = Cust Order Trans

Kindly let us know your feedback.

Thanks,
​​​​​​​Lakshika.

From: Incident <incident@hgts.tech>
Sent: Tuesday, October 17, 2023 6:28 AM
To: Andrea Hernandez <andrea.hernandez@acsind.com>
Subject: Incident #00010687 - Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected (Ref:IN:00010687)

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless recognized
Hi Andrea,

Hope you are doing good.

During the testing phase, we encountered several issues as mentioned below related to the requested CRIM.

1. If the line is canceled in the external PO this change should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.

But if we try to Cancel the Ex PO, then the standard error will be triggered as below.
[https://hgts.file.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=0158W000009dVSHQA2&oid=00D5w000007O5VaEAK&lastMod=702&_CONFIRMATIONTOKEN=VmpFPSxNakF5TXkweE1DMHlNRlF4TVRvMU9Eb3hNQzR4TmpoYSw4REdzVzlpeWpGUlRzVHR2dmxIb1lmOXNIOG9sZG9rRWVwQlppei1tTS1jPSxZVEJoTmpobQ%3D%3D&common.udd.actions.ActionsUtilORIG_URI=%2Fservlet%2Fservlet.FileDownload]

In order to Cancel the Ex PO, as per the error says you have to Cancel, Closed, Unpeg or qty has to be completely manually reserved in the Customer Orders.

But on the other hand, you requested to produce an error when trying to Cancel the internal CO. Therefore we cannot follow the Cancel option as the two behaviors are conflicting. If we unpeg the CO, then the link between orders will be disconnected.

Hence, could you please check and provide your feedback on how we need to proceed with that requirement?[AH]  What do you suggest? Do you think the cancellation should be the other way around? Start with the internal PO and transmit the cancellation to the internal CO and external PO? The goal of this is the user don’t forget to cancel one of the orders, because that create a lot of issues.

2. Currently if the user cancels the Int PO/CO, the error will be triggered as requested. But do we need to consider the changes made for Int CO/PO? That means if the user modifies changes in Internal CO or PO, the error should be triggered.[AH]  Yes, the error should be triggered, but first, we need to resolve the cancellation logic, because if the flow changes in the cancellation (cancel the internal PO and replicate it to the internal CO and external PO), this will also change. We need to tell the buyer one PO that they can modify.

3. And also, since we have to identify the Internal PO/CO and External PO from other orders, we take the assumption as below.[AH]  Seems correct!

* Internal PO - Order Code =4 & Demand Code = Invent Order
* Internal CO - Supply Code = Purch Order Trans & Demand Code = Int Purch Trans
* External PO - Demand Code = Cust Order Trans

Kindly let us know your feedback.

Thanks,
Lakshika.

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Thu, Oct 19, 2023 18:58 PM
To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

1. If there are any changes made to the external PO, the changes should be replicated to the internal CO & internal PO.

If you change the Price, Qty, or dates in the external PO, then it will be replicated to the int CO & PO - you can test this in the ACS Test environment and provide the feedback.

2. Cancellation: if the line is canceled in the external PO this change should be replicated to the internal CO and int PO.

As we informed this can't be performed due to the standard error. Therefore, our suggestion is to start the cancellation from the Internal PO. From the below setup, you can perform this task and in the end, all orders will be canceled.

Note: You have to tick the below option for both sites included in the intersite flow.



After the setup is done, go to the internal PO and cancel the Order. Then you have to RMB the header and click on "Send Change Request". After this, Int CO and External PO will be canceled automatically.



Since we have to start the Cancellation from the Internal PO, we removed the below requirement taken into consideration.

The user must not have access to Cancel the header of the internal PO and internal CO, user should cancel the header of the external PO so the changes will be replicated to the other orders

Kindly check the changes and let us know your feedback.

Regards,
​​​​​​​Lakshika.

records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hgts.tech
Sent: Fri, Oct 20, 2023 19:50 PM
To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

1. If the Change Orders have been enforced for the particular site, then the modifications should be performed by creating a Change Order and it is also mentioned in the spec as well.

Therefore, kindly make the changes through POCO (for Qty & Prices) and let us know the feedback.

2. Shall we arrange a call and discuss the way we can proceed with the Cancellation flow? Because, as per your requirement, the error should be produced when the Internal PO/CO is canceled. And on the other side, according to the standard behavior, you cannot start the cancellation from the External PO.

Therefore, I believe it would be better to discuss this further during the call. Kindly let us know your availability on Monday around 9 AM EST to send the meeting invitation. We'll show the customizations we have done during the call.

Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

Yes, this is correct. We can define those orders from the Site/Company.

But assume if we change the Qty from the PO, the system will ask the below message to replicate changes.



We cannot override the standard messages as we are dealing with only events to develop the CRIM.

Here, the triggering point is changing the Qty in the PO. Even though it is initiated from the internal PO or a change in the external PO itself, at the trigger point system identifies as, this is a change in the external PO.So if we pop up an error for that point, it will emerge for the internal PO changes as well.

This is a complex scenario to perceive and we tested several ways to figure out a process of replicating the changes. But unfortunately, that point is not possible to develop.

Therefore, kindly check and let us know if it is okay to continue with other requirements except this.

Thanks,
Lakshika.

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hoist.tech
Sent: Fri, Nov 10, 2023 13:04 PM
To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

Yes, we can cater below requirements.
1. Replicate changes (Price, Qty, Date, Cancellation) made to the Internal PO for other orders. (Int CO & Ex PO)
2. Block cancellation from Int CO & Ex PO.

But not possible to block of making changes to Ex PO.

Let's get the below example as per your solution.

The user goes to the external PO and changes the Qty. Now the system checks if the PO is from Company 121 & if it has linked orders. If so, then an error will be triggered at the saving point. This seems okay and let's point out this as Validation No 1.

Now we move to Requirement No. 1, user changes the Qty in the internal PO. The change is replicated to the internal CO and next step is to apply the change to the external PO.

However, according to Validation No. 1, the system cannot update the Qty to the external PO by itself and an error will be triggered. The system allows to flow the changes only from one-way.  Therefore, this solution is also not possible to proceed.

Hope this helps. Let me know your thoughts.

Thanks,
Lakshika.

Sent: Mon, Nov 20, 2023 18:56 PM
To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 - Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

As we already communicated, the requirement of blocking changes made to external PO is not feasible to develop and we checked all the possible scenarios to make it work. Unfortunately, this flow is always working only one way and if we add a blocker, then the other way is also blocked.

If you can provide the confirmation, we can start the workings on other requirements. However, according to the technical feasibility, we cannot proceed with the above-mentioned requirement.

Thanks,
Lakshika.

From: incident@hoist.tech

To: andrea.hernandez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)

Hi Andrea,

I'll send the events/customization related to the CRIM at the earliest.

Related to the below point: 
The price in the CO should always be zero, so when replicating the price change from the internal PO only apply it to the external PO.

As per the standard behavior, the price for the part in the CO is fetched from the Sales Part window. According to the requirement, we updated it with the price changed in the internal CO.

As an example, if you update the price as 100 USD in the internal PO line, the CO line is also updated with 100 USD.

But as per the above-highlighted statement, do you need to keep the CO price as 0, every time the internal PO price is updated? (Assume initially the CO line price is 100 USD, and if you update the internal PO line, then CO line price changes from 100 to 0)

Thanks,
Lakshika.

records.BMCServiceDesk__description__c: Email Sent-Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)
records.BMCServiceDesk__note__c:
From: incident@hoist.tech
Sent: Wed, Apr 17, 2024 11:25 AM
To: avaldez@acsind.com;
Subject: Incident #00010687 -  Custom event to prevent cancel orders that are connected  (Ref:IN:00010687)


******************************
Attachments sent with this email(1):
	1. ACS CRIM_PO Intersite Flow_Revised.docx
******************************

Hi Antonio,

1. As per the agreed scope, developed the CRIM to replicate changes to internal CO/external PO from internal PO. According to the initial communication, the changes starting from external PO are not handled through this CRIM. (attached herewith is the functional spec for your reference)

2. Please find the below explanation for "Execute Order Change Online"


If the Execute Order Change Online check box is selected, it indicates that the incoming change request for customer orders and incoming purchase order confirmations, sent from any other site, will be received and processed online on this site.

The benefit of this is that the supply chain will be more synchronized all the time and you will get validations instantly about any errors when changing and sending order changes and confirmations from other sites.

The online processing will only continue as far as the other message defaults parameters allow. If you have manual approval of incoming changes, the online processing stops when an incoming message to approve is created.

If you have automatic approval, then the online processing will validate and update the internal order. If that internal order is pegged and you have automatic replication and sending to next site, the online processing proceeds with this and so on.

Hope this helps.

Thanks,
Lakshika.

Title__c: Customer 41841 reports they are not receiving IFS Shipment Notifications.  Heat
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c: Customer 41841 reports they are not receiving IFS Shipment Notifications.  Heather has looked at IFS Application messages and sees the messages sending from DHC.  The Customer says they have checked spam filters and junkmail for emails from no-reply@deha
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Customer 41841 reports they are not receiving IFS Shipment Notifications.  Heather has looked at IFS Application messages and sees the messages sending from DHC.  The Customer says they have checked spam filters and junkmail for emails from no-reply@dehaprd.ifs.com and sys the emails are not being blocked on their end.  

We request troubleshooting help including a conference call with the Customer's IT team.  Jennifer Asztemborski is the Customer Account Manager (CAM) for this customer and will help ensure the right Customer participants join the calls as needed.

See attached for details.

Customer Order	Shipment Number	Notification Status
C5056062	57544	Finished
C5055278	56988	Finished
C5053349	55456	Finished
C5051154	53603	Finished
C5048488	51384	Finished

Error Message:

Hello @Heather Will, 

Hope you are doing great,
 
Please note that we have received your request and will be assigned to a consultant for resolution.

Failure: Remedy Force attachment integration failed. This DOES NOT impact basic ServiceNow functionality. To alert admins, please raise an incident.

Error Message:

Hi @Heather Will,

Hope you are doing good.
Please find the reason for not getting the shipment notification is the 'Receiver Reference' has not been entered under the General tab in Shipment.
Kindly refer into the attached snap shots.

Thanks & Regards,
Anuki

Failure: Remedy Force attachment integration failed. This DOES NOT impact basic ServiceNow functionality. To alert admins, please raise an incident.

Error Message:

reply from: heather.will@dehavilland.com

Hi Anuki,

The field Receiver Reference is supposed to populate with the value Reference from the Customer Order.  Then we email the customer.  This was working.  Why is it failing now?  CRIM-299

Heather Will, B.Sc., MBA
Project Manager, Customer Care Dash-8  | De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd
Mobile: +1.416.219.9789  | 5800 Explorer Drive, Mississauga, ON L4W 5K9

reply from: heather.will@dehavilland.com

See also RITM0013963

Heather Will, B.Sc., MBA
Project Manager, Customer Care Dash-8  | De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd
Mobile: +1.416.219.9789  | 5800 Explorer Drive, Mississauga, ON L4W 5K9
heather.will@dehavilland.com<mailto:heather.will@dehavilland.com>
PRIVATE AND CONFIDENTIAL (c) De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited or its subsidiaries. All rights reserved.

@Anuki Kumarasinghe
Hi Anuki, 
Teresa and I took another look.  The example you put a screenshot in for is not the scenario we are having a problem with (it is a different order type).  The examples we provided do show a Receiver Reference populated in the Shipment.  Then we check the event message and we see the event finished.  Why isn't the customer getting the email is the problem we need to troubleshoot.
Cheers,
Heather

Hi @Heather Will,

Please find that the previously shared snap shots were taken from based on the Failed Application messages with the subject 'Delivery Note for Shipment%' (Which didn't have 'Receiver Reference').
I referred the RITM0013963 and investigated the CO you shared in the pdf,  C5056062.
If we check the Application Message ID 2901397 and status is in 'Transferred' which is the mail has been sent successfully from the IFS application.
Maybe this mail has gone to Taimur's spam filters or junk mails also could you please share any other orders that they haven't received shipment notification 

Thanks & Best Regards,
Anuki

@Sachith Bandara @Paul Radulescu

Hi Anuki,
The Customer says they have checked spam filters and junkmail for emails from no-reply@dehaprd.ifs.com and sys the emails are not being blocked on their end.   Where else might an electronic message go astray?   
We have several examples for the same customer:
Customer Order	Shipment Number	Notification Status
C5056062	57544	Finished
C5055278	56988	Finished
C5053349	55456	Finished
C5051154	53603	Finished
C5048488	51384	Finished

Hi Paul,
I think the messages are leaving DHC's server, and the customer says they aren't blocked at their end.  Who do you think the right technical troubleshooters to trace this message?  We might need  an expert to get together on a call with the Customer.  Jennifer Asztemborski is the Customer Account Manager (CAM) for this customer and will help ensure the right Customer participants join the calls as needed.

Cheers,
Heather

Hi @Heather Will,

Shall we arrange a call to look into this matter? For the call I could add the technical consultant who implemented this event and whom I investigated this incident.
Kindly suggest a suitable time to arrange a call on Wednesday(5th of July) between 9.30 - 11.30 A.M EST. Then will share the meeting link.

Many Thanks,
Anuki

reply from: jennifer.asztemborski@dehavilland.com

Jazz ( much larger company) restates same issue ... 11604

Jennifer Asztemborski
